page.title: 01South East Grantham.
page.content: The Grantham suburb of New Somerby houses local residents, some of whom work near by in the town's largest factory,Aveling Barford,producing earth moving machinery.At the top of Somerby Hill is the large national Territorial Army depot,housed in the Prince William of Gloucester Barracks.The flat heathland thereabouts was a grass airfield in World War One and continued as a training area until the 1970s.It has now reverted to farmland.Most of the area surveyed is farmland, mainly arable.Across the easten half of the area runs the Roman road Ermine St,locally known as the High Dyke.The regularly spaced houses, about 250 metres apart, along Turnor Rd were built as smallholdings between the 1st and 2nd World Wars but are no longer used as farms.
